tool.name: CreateRivIDGageFile

param.name: input_Drainage_Lines
param.dialogReference: These are the draiange lines with the unique ID of the stream segment as well as the USGS station ID.

param.name: stream_ID
param.dialogReference: The unique ID of the stream segment.

param.name: gage_adjusted_id
param.dialogReference: This is the field with the value of the gauge adjusted streamflow for the stream segment.

param.name: out_rivID_gageID_file
param.displayname: Output River ID Gage ID File
param.dialogReference: This is the output file used in the Streamflow Prediction Tool processing.

tool.summary:
This will generate the file connecting the unique ID of the river segment with the USGS station used in the processing workflow of the Streamflow Prediction Tool (SPT). More information about the SPT can be found here:

Snow, Alan D., Scott D. Christensen, Nathan R. Swain, E. James Nelson, Daniel P. Ames, Norman L. Jones, Deng Ding, Nawajish S. Noman, Cedric H. David, Florian Pappenberger, and Ervin Zsoter, 2016. A High-Resolution National-Scale Hydrologic Forecast System from a Global Ensemble Land Surface Model. Journal of the American Water Resources Association (JAWRA) 1-15, DOI: 10.1111/1752-1688.12434

dataIdInfo.idAbs:
This will generate the file connecting the unique ID of the river segment with the USGS station used in the processing workflow of the Streamflow Prediction Tool (SPT). More information about the SPT can be found here:

Snow, Alan D., Scott D. Christensen, Nathan R. Swain, E. James Nelson, Daniel P. Ames, Norman L. Jones, Deng Ding, Nawajish S. Noman, Cedric H. David, Florian Pappenberger, and Ervin Zsoter, 2016. A High-Resolution National-Scale Hydrologic Forecast System from a Global Ensemble Land Surface Model. Journal of the American Water Resources Association (JAWRA) 1-15, DOI: 10.1111/1752-1688.12434
